text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
“Exact vengeance for the Israelites from the Midianites—after that you will be gathered to your people.”
So Moses spoke to the people: “Arm men from among you for the war, to attack the Midianites and to execute the Lord’s vengeance on Midian.

You must <st data-num="07971" class="">send</st> to the <st data-num="06635" class="">battle</st> <st data-num="0505 0505">1,000</st> men from <st data-num="04294" class="">every</st> <st data-num="04294" class="">tribe</st> throughout <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04294" class="">tribes</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.”<n id="1" />
So 1,000 from every tribe, 12,000 armed for battle in all, were provided out of the thousands of Israel.
So Moses sent them to the war, 1,000 from every tribe, with Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest, who was in charge of the holy articles and the signal trumpets.
They fought against the Midianites, as the Lord commanded Moses, and they killed every male.
They killed the kings of Midian in addition to those slain—Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba—five Midianite kings. They also killed Balaam son of Beor with the sword.
The Israelites took the women of Midian captive along with their little ones, and took all their herds, all their flocks, and all their goods as plunder.

They <st data-num="08313 0784">burned</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> their <st data-num="05892" class="">towns</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="04186" class="">where</st> they <st data-num="04186" class="">lived</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> their <st data-num="02918" class="">encampments</st>.

They <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="07998" class="">plunder</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04455" class="">spoils</st>, both <st data-num="0120" class="">people</st> and <st data-num="0929" class="">animals</st>.

They <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> the <st data-num="07628" class="">captives</st> and the <st data-num="04455" class="">spoils</st> and the <st data-num="07998" class="">plunder</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st>, <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0499" class="">Eleazar</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st>, and <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelite</st> <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st>, <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="06160" class="">rift valley plains</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st>, <st data-num="05921" class="">along</st> the <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st> River<n id="2" /> across from <st data-num="03405" class="">Jericho</st>.<n id="3" />
Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the community went out to meet them outside the camp.
But Moses was furious with the officers of the army, the commanders over thousands and commanders over hundreds, who had come from service in the war.

<st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them, “Have you allowed <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05347" class="">women</st> to <st data-num="02421" class="">live</st>?<n id="1" />
Look, these people through the counsel of Balaam caused the Israelites to act treacherously against the Lord in the matter of Peor—which resulted in the plague among the community of the Lord!

<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st> therefore <st data-num="02026" class="">kill</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="02145 02945">boy</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="02026" class="">kill</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> who has <st data-num="03045" class="">been intimate</st> with a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> in <st data-num="04904 02145">bed</st>.<n id="2" />
But all the young women who have not experienced a man’s bed will be yours.
“Any of you who has killed anyone or touched any of the dead, remain outside the camp for seven days; purify yourselves and your captives on the third day, and on the seventh day.
You must purify each garment and everything that is made of skin, everything made of goats’ hair, and everything made of wood.”
Then Eleazar the priest said to the men of war who had gone into the battle, “This is the ordinance of the law that the Lord commanded Moses:

‘<st data-num="0389" class="">Only</st> the <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, the <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, the <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st>, the <st data-num="01270" class="">iron</st>, the <st data-num="0913" class="">tin</st>, and the <st data-num="05777" class="">lead</st>,

<st data-num="03605 01697">everything</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> may <st data-num="0935" class="">stand</st> the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st>, you are to <st data-num="05674" class="">pass through</st> the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st>,<n id="1" /> and it will <st data-num="02891" class="">be ceremonially clean</st>, <st data-num="0389" class="">but</st> it must still be <st data-num="02398" class="">purified</st> with the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> of <st data-num="05079" class="">purification</st>. <st data-num="03605" class="">Anything</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">cannot</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">withstand</st> the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> you must <st data-num="05674" class="">pass through</st> the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>.
You must wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you will be ceremonially clean, and afterward you may enter the camp.’”
Then the Lord spoke to Moses:

“<st data-num="0859" class="">You</st> and <st data-num="0499" class="">Eleazar</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st>, and all the <st data-num="01" class="">family</st> <st data-num="07218" class="">leaders</st> of the <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st>, <st data-num="05375" class="">take</st> the <st data-num="07218" class="">sum</st><n id="1" /> of the <st data-num="04455" class="">plunder</st> that was <st data-num="07628" class="">captured</st>, both <st data-num="0120" class="">people</st> and <st data-num="0929" class="">animals</st>.
Divide the plunder into two parts, one for those who took part in the war—who went out to battle—and the other for all the community.
“You must exact a tribute for the Lord from the fighting men who went out to battle: one life out of 500, from the people, the cattle, and from the donkeys and the sheep.
You are to take it from their half share and give it to Eleazar the priest for a raised offering to the Lord.

From the Israelites’ half share you are to take one portion out of 50 of the people, the cattle, the donkeys, and the sheep—from every kind of animal—and you are to give them to the Levites, who are responsible for the care of the Lord’s tabernacle.”
So Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the Lord commanded Moses.

The <st data-num="04455" class="">spoil</st> that <st data-num="03499" class="">remained</st> of the <st data-num="0957" class="">plunder</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="06635" class="">fighting</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">men</st><n id="1" /> had <st data-num="0962" class="">gathered</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="08337 03967 0505 07657 0505 02568 0505">675,000</st> <st data-num="06629" class="">sheep</st>,
<st data-num="08147 07657 0505">72,000</st> <st data-num="01241" class="">cattle</st>,
<st data-num="0259 08346 0505">61,000</st> <st data-num="02543" class="">donkeys</st>,
and 32,000 young women who had not experienced a man’s bed.
The half portion of those who went to war numbered 337,500 sheep;
the Lord’s tribute from the sheep was 675.
The cattle numbered 36,000; the Lord’s tribute was 72.
The donkeys were 30,500, of which the Lord’s tribute was 61.
The people were 16,000, of which the Lord’s tribute was 32 people.
So Moses gave the tribute, which was the Lord’s raised offering, to Eleazar the priest, as the Lord commanded Moses.
From the Israelites’ half share that Moses had separated from the fighting men,

<st data-num="01961" class="">there were</st> <st data-num="07969 03967 0505 07970 0505 07651 0505 02568 03967">337,500</st> <st data-num="06629" class="">sheep</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="04275" class="">portion</st> belonging to the <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st>,
<st data-num="08337 07970 0505">36,000</st> <st data-num="01241" class="">cattle</st>,
From the Israelites’ share Moses took one of every 50 people and animals and gave them to the Levites who were responsible for the care of the Lord’s tabernacle, just as the Lord commanded Moses.
Then the officers who were over the thousands of the army, the commanders over thousands and the commanders over hundreds, approached Moses

and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">him</st>,<n id="1" /> “Your <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> have <st data-num="05375" class="">taken</st> a <st data-num="07218" class="">count</st><n id="2" /> of the <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> who were in the <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> were under our <st data-num="03027" class="">authority</st>,<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">one</st> <st data-num="06485" class="">is missing</st>.
So we have brought as an offering for the Lord what each man found: gold ornaments, armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and necklaces, to make atonement for ourselves before the Lord.”

<st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> and <st data-num="0499" class="">Eleazar</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> the <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">from</st> them, <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> of it in the <st data-num="04639" class="">form</st> of <st data-num="03627" class="">ornaments</st>.
All the gold of the offering they offered up to the Lord from the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds weighed 16,750 shekels.
<st data-num="0376" class="">Each</st> <st data-num="0376 06635">soldier</st> had <st data-num="0962" class="">taken plunder</st> for himself.
So Moses and Eleazar the priest received the gold from the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds and brought it into the tent of meeting as a memorial for the Israelites before the Lord.
